thread.title: Adorable baby elephant plays with birds in South Africa's Kruger National park
thread.title_full: Adorable baby elephant plays with birds in South Africa's Kruger National park

title: Adorable baby elephant plays with birds in South Africa's Kruger National park
text:
Adorable baby elephant plays with birds in South Africa's Kruger National park Last updated 11:34, July 30 2015 
This baby elephant playing with a flock of birds in Kruger National Park is all you need to make your day better. 
The video was uploaded to Youtube by Kruger Sightings with the caption: "Such a cute video of a tiny new-born elephant trying to chase away the low flying swallows that are around him". 
Kruger National park in northeast South Africa is the continent's second largest national park. Youtube/KrugerSightings 
It's not great at chasing away the birds but this baby elephant is definitely having fun. 
It has the most large mammals of any African game reserve, including the 'big five' - lion, elephant, Cape buffalo, leopard and rhinoceros - and the endangered African Wild Dog, of which there are thought to be only about 400 in the whole of South Africa. 
If you still need another reason to plan a trip to Africa, check out our guide on the top 5 spots in Africa to see wildlife.
